column_.text_:
Press  while moving to dash.

If Auto Dash is enabled, you'll automatically dash after
running for a short period of time.

If you hold  after dodging, you'll also start dashing.

Tap  to jump. Hold the button to stay in the
air for longer.

Your attacks will prioritize foes that you've locked on to.
If there's no locked-on target, you'll attack the
nearest foe.

combos can be performed in midair. It's also possible to
continue an airborne combo after a midair dodge by attacking
right after dodging.

Press  while airborne to perform an attack that targets
foes on the ground. For some characters, their  attack is
the same regardless of where it's performed.

Each character has a unique attack performed by pressing the
 button. Check out a character's command list in Lyria's
Journal to learn how they fight.

Press  while airborne to dive attack foes on the ground.
Some characters will attack while remaining airborne
instead.

Press  as you jump to knock a foe into the air. Foes are
defenseless while launched, making it the perfect way to
land major damage! Launch is unlocked from Masteries.

Some characters can charge up their attacks by holding down
the attack button. Check out a character's command list to
see which attacks are chargeable.

Some characters can perform enhanced versions of their
attacks with well-timed button presses. Check out a
character's command list to see if they can perform any
perfect strikes.

Charged parry is unlockable from Masteries.
Hit a foe with a charged attack right before you take damage
to nullify their attack and counter with your own.
Temporary Lock On and Target Switching

Instead of pressing  to toggle lock on, you can hold  to
lock on to a foe until releasing .

To switch targets while locked on, tilt  or double-tap .

Press  to lock on to a foe and center the camera on your
target. Tilt  to switch targets while locked on.

Skills can be reviewed and assigned from the Skills screen,
and up to four skills can be assigned to a character at a
time. Check out Masteries to unlock new skills.

Skill icons are visual indicators of a skill's availability
and element. Skills with darkened icons are on cooldown and
can't be used. Some skills can be used multiple times in a
row, and some can be modified by holding the button. A
skill's element is indicated by the icon's border color.

A Skybound Art (SBA) is performed by pressing  and  with
a full SBA gauge. The SBA gauge fills whenever you deal
damage or take damage. Any SBA performed by another party
member also fills your SBA gauge.

Chaining Skybound Arts triggers a chain burst. A chain
burst's power is based on the number of SBAs that were
activated. Triggering a chain burst also increases link
level. The character that started the chain determines the
element of the chain burst.

To change how your allies use their SBAs, press  during
battle, and then  to toggle between Auto or Hold. Allies
will use their SBAs immediately when set to Auto, otherwise
they'll save them until you activate your own. Additional
Skybound Arts settings are configurable in Game Options.

Although guarding with  nullifies damage from foe
attacks, status ailments and certain powerful attacks are
unblockable.

The color of your guard changes as it blocks continuous
hits. Blocking an attack while your guard is red causes a
guard break, which will leave you temporarily defenseless.

Although guarding with  nullifies damage from foe
attacks, status ailments and certain powerful attacks are
unblockable.

Guarding right before a foe's attack lands will block the
attack while nullifying knockback. A perfect guard also
fills the stun gauges of nearby foes. Perfect guard is
unlocked from Masteries.

Even if you dodge during a combo, you can resume the combo
by attacking immediately after dodging.

Dodge a foe's attack just before it hits to gain a temporary
Invincibility effect. Perfect dodge is unlocked from
Masteries.

If an attack knocks you off your feet, press  to quickly
recover and stick the landing.

Even if you do get knocked down, simply press any button
to quickly get back up.

Attacking a foe fills their stun gauge, which is located
below their health bar. Once the stun gauge is full, a blue
circle will cover the ground. This is a link chance.

Press  while inside the circle before it disappears to
perform a link attack.

Attacking a foe fills their stun gauge, which appears under
their health. When the stun gauge becomes full, a blue
circle will expand over the ground. Press  inside the
circle before it disappears to perform a link attack.

Stun power affects how quickly the stun gauge fills up.
The  icon represents stun power.

A foe's stun gauge fills up as it takes damage. When its
stun gauge is completely full, you'll have a chance to 
perform a link attack.
Stun power affects how quickly the stun gauge fills up.
The  icon represents stun power.

Even if you perform a link attack in the middle of a combo,
you can resume the combo by attacking immediately after the
link attack.

The following actions increase the party's link level:
・Landing a link attack
・Using a Skybound Art
・Triggering a chain burst
・Using a blue potion
・Rescuing an ally

Once link level reaches 100%, if all party members perform
a link attack, you'll enter link time.

Revive an ally, use a blue potion, land a link attack, use a
Skybound Art, or trigger a chain burst to raise link level.
Perform a link attack with all party members when your
link level is at 100% to activate link time.

Link time is triggered when each party member performs a
link attack when the link level is at 100%. All foe actions
slow down considerably, and you gain various beneficial
status effects. Landing hits on foes also extends the
duration of link time!

Hold the corresponding button to use that item in battle.
(): Green potion restores some of your health.
(): Mega potion restores all of your health.
(): Blue potion restores some health to the entire party.
(): Revival potion instantly rescues you from critical
condition.

If you fall off the map or from a high enough height, you'll
be returned to the spot before the fall. Your character will
lose some health, but they can't enter critical condition.

Critical hits deal more damage than normal and always hit
for full damage. The  icon represents critical hit rate.

Stun power determines a character's effectiveness at filling
a foe's stun gauge and destroying foe parts. The  icon
represents stun power.

Attacking with the superior element or landing critical hits
allows you to deal more damage than normal. However, every
character's attacks, Skybound Art, and skills have a limit
to how much damage they can deal, known as a damage cap.
To raise a character's damage cap, equip certain sigils or
unlock certain Mastery nodes.

You'll enter critical condition when your HP reaches 0.
Either wait to naturally recover or use a revival potion.

Press  near a party member in critical condition to speed
up their recovery. If more allies join the rescue, they'll
recover even faster!

The critical gauge depletes whenever a party member enters
critical condition. Once the gauge reaches 0, it's game
over, so make sure everyone stays healthy!

Larger bosses may take different amounts of damage based on
where they are hit. Try targeting other areas of their body
if your attacks seem ineffective. Critical hits deal damage
regardless of where they land.

Attacking certain parts of a large-sized boss will deal more
damage to them. That damage can be boosted even further by
equipping gear with traits that target weak points.

Certain objects or body parts are destructible. Destroying
these alters a foe's behavior and may yield more rewards
after the battle. Destroying things is easier with higher
stun power.

Bosses have a mode bar that fills up when they take damage.
They enter Overdrive when the bar is full, gaining offensive
and defensive stat boosts, plus access to stronger attacks.

Damage dealt to bosses in Overdrive depletes their mode bar.
They enter Break when the bar reaches 0, leaving them wide
open!

Bosses have a mode bar that fills up when they take damage
and enter Overdrive when the bar is full. Damage dealt to
bosses in Overdrive depletes the bar. They enter Break
when the bar reaches 0, leaving them wide open!

Some bosses may gain the Bloodthirst effect. While in this
state, they take greatly reduced damage and are immune to
various status ailments. Adopting a defensive strategy until
Bloodthirst wears off may be the better option.

Damage types are identifiable by their colors.
 : Damage dealt to a foe.
 : Damage dealt to a foe (superior element).
 : Damage dealt to a foe while it guards.
 : Damage taken by you.
 : Damage taken by you while guarding.

Press  to pick up explosive barrels or objects dropped by
foes and then press  again to throw. You can manually aim
the throw when not locked on to a target.

Dodging or getting knocked down will cause your character
to drop the object.

Press  to pick up explosive barrels or objects dropped by
foes and then press  again to throw. You can manually aim
the throw when not locked on to a target.
Action speed and DEF are lowered
Sharp boost to resistance against all attacks
ATK is boosted based on how low HP is
Combat ability is greatly boosted by dragon power
Survive lethal DMG with 1 HP left
Takes DMG in place of an ally
Taking damage doesn't interrupt character actions
Next infliction of Darkflame sets off a big explosion
ATK is boosted based on how high HP is
DMG is nullified for a set number of hits
Action speed and DEF are lowered
Combat ability is boosted by dragon power
Actions are limited and movement speed is lowered

Add items to your wish list to track where they can be
obtained from and which quests offer them as rewards.

Save party formations, equipped weapons, sigils, and skills
as party sets and loadouts. This allows you to quickly
switch between different setups without needing to make
manual adjustments every time.

Select Customize Character from the Character Details screen
to change the captain's appearance. Appearance is cosmetic
and doesn't affect the captain's stats.

Characters gain a level when they earn enough experience,
which is rewarded for clearing quests and defeating foes.
Leveling up raises health and attack power. Once a character
reaches level 100, you'll get Knickknack vouchers and MSP
every time they accumulate a set amount of experience.

Weapons modify health and attack power. They also come with
traits, which grant certain effects.

Spend treasure and rupies to level up your weapons and
sigils. Leveling up a weapon raises its health and attack
stats. Leveling up a sigil raises the level of its traits.

Each weapon has a maximum level it can be leveled up to.
Raising this level cap is called uncapping. Refinium is a
specific type of treasure required to uncap a weapon.

The game's difficulty can be changed at any time.
Assist Mode can't be enabled for certain difficulty levels.

PWR is an aggregate value of a character's level, gear, and
Masteries. It's represented by the  icon. Treat PWR as a
guideline in determining your readiness for a quest.

Trophies are awarded for completing specific feats and
can be displayed in your profile. Some trophies even come
with rewards. Take a peek at Lyria's Journal to learn how to
unlock a trophy.

Once a character reaches level 80, they can earn Extended
Mastery Points which can be used to further enhance various
stats and skills.

Head to the quest counter to challenge various quests and
view fate episodes. You can also go online and quest with
other players.

Replay your favorite parts of the story and collect items
you might've missed the first time. The captain doesn't have
to be in your party when replaying chapters.

Ultimate difficulty offers the ultimate thrill to action-
hungry skyfarers. Foes get a significant upgrade, but so do
the rewards for defeating them.

Quick quests allow you to randomly join a quest started by
another player. Characters may be scaled for balance
depending on the quest.
Quick quests award Dalia badges. You can spend one
gold badge ticket to earn one more gold Dalia
badge.

Fulfill certain conditions to view a character's fate episode.
Get to know your crewmates better and earn rewards in the
process.

Some fate episodes have quests that must be completed in
order to proceed. These quests have special requirements
and rewards, so be prepared before tackling them.
Visit the blacksmith to upgrade weapons or sell items.

New weapons can be forged by exchanging champion
merits at the blacksmith. Every weapon has their own
stats and traits, so expand your arsenal to gain the edge
in battle.
Sigils have trait effects that grow stronger as they level.

A mirage munition can be fused to a weapon to boost its
attack and health stats. Munitions can be removed and fused
to other weapons, so don't be afraid to use them.

Certain weapons, such as the Sword of Eos, can be upgraded
in ways other weapons can't. Once these weapons reach their
maximum level, bring them to Siero to learn how to wring out
every last drop of power.

A wrightstone grants a weapon up to three additional traits
when used at the blacksmith, but once it's used, it's gone.
These traits can be replaced by using another wrightstone.
Wrightstones are obtainable from transmuting sigils or
earned as rewards for clearing Extreme-difficulty or higher
quests.

This is the one-stop shop for all your adventuring needs!
Not only does Sierokarte stock rare items, she can even call
in new crewmates with crewmate cards.

Knickknack vouchers can be exchanged for sigils. Exchange
more vouchers for a shot at rarer sigils.

Dalia badges come in gold and silver. They're awarded for
completing quick quests.

Exchange them for valuable items at the Knickknack Shack.

You'll find crewmate cards as the story progresses. Give
one to Siero, and a new character will join you on your
journey.

Trade treasures you don't need for ones you do at the
Knickknack Shack. Make treasure hunting a little easier by
adding items you're looking for to your wish list.

Knickknack vouchers are used to transmute sigils. Trade
unneeded treasure, sigils, and wrightstones for more
vouchers.

Visit Zathba to have him appraise a curio. It's a
good way to earn items and rupies.

Curios are obtainable from any Veteran Skyfarer-grade
or higher quest. Bring curios to Zathba in Seedhollow and reap
the rewards.

You can travel to other towns, board the Grandcypher, or
resume the main story from a town's dock.

These books provide characters with a wealth of instant
experience. There are three types of books, and each one
grants a different amount of experience. They're usable
from the Inventory screen.

Ambrosia is an item that gives MSP and is mainly obtained
by trading Dalia badges. Ambrosia can be consumed by
selecting it from the Inventory screen.

When given to a blacksmith, this precious metal can be used
to uncap weapons in lieu of regular materials. However, it
can't be used in weapon awakenings.

Use this beautiful stone on a sigil at the blacksmith to
instantly raise it to its maximum level.

Dealing a large amount of damage relative to a foe's
remaining health results in an overkill. Overkills grant
more MSP and experience.

Clearing a quest faster yields more MSP and experience. Use
every trick up your sleeve to shave seconds off your run.

Defend-type quests may require you to protect hallowed
ground from incoming hordes of enemies. Approach hallowed
ground and press  to touch it. This will make foes less
hostile, but you won't be able to touch hallowed ground
again for a period of time.

Press  to instantly travel between a town's points of
interest, a precious time-saver especially when navigating
the sprawl of Seedhollow. To fly to a different town, use
the docks.

Use the wheel to fly to different towns. You can also spend
time training with Sir Barrold.

Interact with Sir Barrold on the Grandcypher to access
Training. Practicing is a great way to learn the ins and outs
of how your party members fight. Who knows what high-flying
combos you'll concoct!

While on a story mission, you can return to the town you
last visited and still keep any earned items and experience.
Upon resuming the story mission, you'll start from the last
checkpoint.

If a certain area is giving you a hard time, do some quests,
level up your characters and gear, and you'll be back on
track in no time!

While on a story mission, you can return to the town you
last visited and still keep any earned items and experience.
Upon resuming the story mission, you'll start from the last
checkpoint.

Touching Hallowed Ground fully heals your party's health
and replenishes your recovery items.

Hallowed Ground allows you to save your game as well as
use services offered by the blacksmith and Knickknack Shack.

If you get a game over while fighting a boss, you can retry
from the start of the boss fight or restart from a previous
checkpoint.

Some characters must be in your party during certain fate
episodes and parts of the main story. The captain must
always be in your party throughout the main story but can be
removed when replaying chapters via chapter select.

Many people across the Zegagrande Skydom are in need of
help. Talk to them to undertake optional side quests and
earn valuable loot. Check the Side Quests menu to track the
progress of any side quests you've accepted. You can even
fast travel to a quest client if you're in the same town as
they are.

These rare creatures exist throughout the Sky Realm. Squash
them before they flee, or say goodbye to the treasure trove
of rupies and experience. Who knows what else they could be
hoarding within their pots?

A rare denizen of Zegagrande, these little guys prefer to
stay hidden from sight. Exchange them with a collector in
Folca for various rewards.

You never know what treasures might be lying around just
waiting to be found. Press  when you come across something
shiny.

All kinds of treasure chests filled with rupies and loot can
be found across the skies. Fancier looking chests tend to
hide better stuff inside.

Learn about Zegagrande Skydom by discovering notes and
records scattered throughout the islands. Some of these can
be tricky to find.

Lyria will save your discoveries in the archives of her
journal.

The following types of quests are available:
Boss: Test your strength against powerful bosses.
Survival: Defeat as many foes within a time limit.
Horde: Repel wave after wave of foes.
Conquest: Defeat all foes on a map.
Defend: Defend a target for a duration of time.
Explore: Collect specific items within a time limit.

Rewards and items vary for each quest type.

Press  to access multiple communication tools.
Emotes: Perform a gesture.
Stickers: Send a sticker.
Chat: Type and send messages.

The session leader can be changed to another player.
Only the current leader can assign a new leader.

The session leader is the only one who may kick a player.
However, other players can make a request to the leader to
kick a player. This is done from Co-Op Settings.

Following a player saves them to your Following list, which
allows you to send them a party invite directly. You can
follow a player from their profile page or from the battle
results screen after a quest.

Press  on the Main Menu screen to view a character's
details. While viewing character details, press  to bring
up that character's command list. This list shows the button
combinations needed to perform certain attacks and combos.

These status effects improve offensive capabilities:

ATK↑: ATK is boosted
Critical Hit Rate↑: Critical hit rate is boosted
Supplementary DMG: Deals additional DMG on hit
Jammed: ATK is boosted based on how low HP is
Strength: ATK is boosted based on how high HP is

These status effects improve health recovery:

Regen: HP is recovered over time
Drain: Recover HP upon dealing DMG
Autorevive: Automatically recover from critical condition

These status effects improve defensive capabilities:

DMG Cut: DMG taken is lowered
DEF↑: DEF is boosted
Mirror Image: DMG is nullified for a set number of hits
Invincibility: DMG taken is nullified
Guts: Survive lethal DMG with 1 HP left
Debuff Immunity: All status ailments are nullified
Abyssal Glory: DEF is boosted and all status ailments are nullified
Bloodthirst: Sharp boost to resistance against all attacks

There are other kinds of beneficial status effects,
including some that are character-specific.

Substitute: Takes DMG in place of an ally
Covered: Defended by an ally
Stout Heart: Taking damage doesn't interrupt character actions
Phantasmagoria: ATK, DEF, and critical hit rate are boosted
Hostility↑: More likely to be attacked

These status ailments deal damage to the afflicted target:

Burn: HP is lost over time
Poison: HP is lost over time
Blight: HP is lost over time
Darkflame: Next infliction of Darkflame sets off a big explosion

These status ailments modify a target's stats or cause them
to take more damage.

ATK↓: ATK is lowered
DEF↓: DEF is lowered
Arvess Fermare: Takes more DMG from Zeta's attacks

These status ailments hinder the ability to move or act:
Paralysis: Actions can't be performed
Dizzy: Actions can't be performed
Frostbite: Action speed and DEF are lowered
Glaciate: Actions can't be performed
Held Under: Actions can't be performed
Petrified: Action speed and DEF are lowered
Slow: Action speed is lowered
Sandtomb: Actions are limited and movement speed is lowered
Bound: Actions can't be performed

These status ailments disable certain actions:

Skill Sealed: Can't use skills
SBA Sealed: Can't use SBA

Performing combo finishers and link attacks will raise the
captain's Arts level. Additionally, following up a link attack
with  will greatly reduce its charge time.

Own the battlefield by performing link attacks whenever the
chance arises!

The captain's Adept Arts level will reset shortly after
activating a skill, so it's wise to maximize hard-earned
levels by unleashing multiple skills at the same time.
Certain mastery nodes will even extend the window
between skill activation and Arts level reset.

Once summoned, Ares will fight alongside Katalina,
bolstering her skills, link attacks, and Skybound Arts.
After a certain amount of time has elapsed, Ares will
be dismissed; however, Katalina can prolong the primal's
appearance by performing the aforementioned actions.

Utilize the primal's might to create devastating
attack sequences!

Performing combo finishers and link attacks will fill the
Ares gauge. If a link attack would summon Ares, Katalina
can avoid consuming the gauge by refraining from using
actions that utilize Ares.

Own the battlefield by performing link attacks whenever the
chance arises!

Immediately after participating in a link attack or using
an offensive skill, Katalina can execute a combo finisher
by performing a  attack. To add to the brutality,
unlocking Ares Pactstrike from Katalina's Masteries allows
Ares to follow up combo finishers for more damage.

Knights have nothing to fear—so long as they act
in tandem!

The distance between Rackam and his target influences the
firepower of his  and  attacks. Get too far,
and his damage will nosedive. Find that sweet spot for
maximum boom!

As a helmsman and gunner, Rackam's eyes are second to none.
That helps him lock on to different body parts of larger
foes, allowing him to hit potential weak spots.

Keep those eyes peeled to maximize damage!

Io gains Mystic Vortex orbs by using her charged  attack,
casting offensive spells, and participating in link attacks.
Once gathered, she can consume these orbs to charge up a
powerful  attack.

Accumulate orbs quickly by mixing up Io's offense between
 attacks, spells, and link attacks!

If Io suspends charging Stargaze to participate in a link
attack, she can resume incantation by immediately pressing
 once more. In addition, unlocking Quick Cast from Io's
Masteries provides a substantial boost to Stargaze's charge
speed.

The key to advanced spellcraft is mastering the details!

The distance between Eugen and his target influences the
firepower of his  gun attacks. Get too far, and his
damage will take a hit.

Keep moving to find the perfect shot!

When Eugen takes aim in sniper vision, he can target body
parts of larger foes to potentially deal more damage. His
grenades will also fly farther while looking through his scope.

Grenades deal a lot of stun and make good tools for
destroying enemy parts, so lob 'em if you got 'em!

Once planted, roses will slowly begin to wither and lose
levels if their attacks don't connect with foes. After
Rosetta has planted the maximum number of roses, press 
to replant the oldest rose to a new spot.

Carefully cultivate the placement of your garden and reap
massive rewards!

Hold  to designate where to plant a rose, or tap  when
locked on to a foe to plant a rose near them.

Remember the mantra for effective rose usage:
"Location, location, location!"

Whenever Ferry lands a charged  attack, performs a link
attack, or activates specific skills, one of her pets will
manifest to attack nearby foes for a brief amount of time.

Summon all of Ferry's pets quickly so that they can dogpile
hapless foes while she whips up a storm with Onslaught!

Hold  or  to prolong Ferry's attack. Upon releasing the
button, she'll add in an extra hit for good measure. To make
that final hit even stronger, keep holding  until she is
bathed in a brilliant aura.

Her  and  attacks hurt more when she whacks foes with the
tip of her whip. Don't just flail wildly if you want to get
the most out of this ghost!

Normally, Lancelot has to build up his combo before his
rapid slashes get going. However, he can combo directly
into those slashes by rapidly tapping  right after
performing a link attack or activating specific skills.

When Lancelot dodges with Twin Blade Dance during his rapid
slashes, if  is rapidly tapped right after Twin Blade Dance,
he'll resume his fast-paced cuts without losing steam!

Vane recovers health as a portion of the damage dealt by his
combo finishers and  combos.

Additionally, when his  attack meets a foe's attack, he'll
block it and keep swinging for damage. His guard can't be
broken during this attack.

Be bold and courageous with your attacks.
No pain, no (health) gain!

Performing combo finishers and link attacks will fill Vane's Beatdown
gauge. Additionally, he can launch into a combo finisher by
pressing  immediately after performing a link attack
or damage skill!

If Vane performs a link attack during a Beatdown combo, he
can resume the Beatdown combo by pressing .

There's no reason not to link attack often!

Percival's  attack charges much faster when charged right
after performing a link attack or activating a damage skill.

Learning Adrenaline Rush from his Masteries allows him to
charge a  attack faster as well.

Utilize Schlacht efficiently to take charge of any
situation!

If Siegfried dodges or performs a link attack during a
combo, he can resume the combo by immediately attacking
afterward. This applies to perfectly timed  attacks as well.

After jumping high into the air with a  attack, Charlotta
can close the gap between her and a foe with an aerial
lunge attack by pressing , or she can thrust her sword
straight downward for big damage by pressing .

Normally, Charlotta has to build up her combo before her
rapid slashes get going. However, she can combo directly
into those slashes by rapidly tapping  right after
performing a link attack or activating a damage skill.

Learn Noble Stance from her Masteries to power up her rapid
 attacks as well as  attacks.

Don't give foes even a second to catch their breath!

Performing combo finishers and link attacks will grant Yodarha
Triple Shroud marks. Additionally, he can combo directly into a
combo finisher by pressing  right after performing a link attack
or activating a damage skill!

Link attack often for a constant flow of Triple Shroud marks!

Instead of tapping  to perform a lunge attack, hold  to
have Yodarha assume a ready stance. He'll still perform a
a lunge attack when  is released, but if  is released just
before a foe's attack hits him, he'll parry it and counter.

Press  right after countering to start a shortened combo
that leads into a  combo finisher, which can then be chained
into another  attack for a combo loop!

When Narmaya is in Dawnfly stance, her  attack charges
faster when charged from a  combo.

Her  attack also charges faster when charged right after
performing a link attack, activating a damage skill, or
triggering a stance shift combo from Freeflutter.

Master the timing, and send foes to an early grave!

When Narmaya is in Freeflutter stance, she can combo
directly into the multi-slash portion of her combo by
rapidly tapping  after performing a link attack, activating
a damage skill, or triggering a stance shift combo from
Dawnfly stance.

Master this technique, and cut foes to shreds!

The butterflies fluttering by Narmaya's side don't just
enhance her skills; they boost her stats as well. She'll
deal more damage in Freeflutter stance and more stun in
Dawnfly stance based on how many butterflies she has.

The more butterflies on the field, the more damage inflicted
on your foes!

The accumulation of Eternal Rage plays a vital role in
powering up Ghandagoza's kicks and punches.

He'll gradually lose Eternal Rage over time, but attacking
with  combos or activating skills will maintain
his fury.

Fight relentlessly to keep his Eternal Rage high and channel
that energy into his devastating charged  attacks!

If Ghandagoza dodges or performs a link attack during a
combo, he can resume the combo by immediately attacking
afterward. Resuming the combo with a perfectly timed
attack generates more devastating results.

Performing a combo finisher isn't the only way to high jump
off of a foe; activating specific damage skills or pressing 
right after performing a link attack triggers one too.

Each consecutive  loop combo gains increased
damage and stun, maxing out on the third loop.

Additionally, if a  attack is performed right after a link
attack, the  loop combo will become fully powered up!

Performing combo finishers and link attacks will fill Vaseraga's
Grynoth gauge. Additionally, he can launch into a combo
finisher by pressing  immediately after performing a link
attack!

The Grynoth gauge starts to deplete if Vaseraga hasn't
struck a foe for a certain amount of time, so try to reap
foes without pause!

Cagliostro's  attack charges much faster when charged right
after performing a link attack or activating a damage skill.
Unlocking Adrenaline Rush from her Masteries also allows her
 attack to charge faster after a combo finisher.

Make foes collapse before the might of the genius alchemist!

Cagliostro's alchemical arsenal is geared for a wide range
of combat situations. Combine  and  attacks
for a variety of effects.

: Mid-range spear attack
: AOE attack with high stun
: Short-range multi-hit attack
: Powerful short-range attack

Performing specific  attacks aren't the only way to fill
the Versalis gauge; performing a link attack or activating a
damage skill does too.  attacks also charge much faster
when charged after using a link attack or damage skill.

Try to fill up the Versalis gauge as quickly as possible!

Id has access to different skills and / attacks while in
Dragonform. He can also directly combo into the fast, multi-hit
section of his combo by rapidly tapping  or  right after
performing a combo finisher, link attack, or activating a skill.

Pummel foes into dust before Id returns to his regular self!

While in Godmight, not only is Id immune to all status
ailments, he also gains a big boost to his attack power.
However, all power is fleeting—as soon as Id uses his unique
 combo, he'll return to being normal Id.
